content.description: The hospital, Ross, Rachel, Chandler, Joey, and Monica are in the waiting room, waiting for Carol and Susan to arrive.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She’s not here yet. She’s not here. She’s having my baby and she’s not here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sure everything’s fine. Has her water broke yet?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know, but when I spoke to her, she said she had already passed the mucus plug.
(Joey makes a sound of absolute disgust.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do we have to know about that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, what are you gonna do when you have a baby?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m gonna be in the waitin’ room, handing out cigars.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, Joey’s made arrangements to have his baby in a movie from the 50’s.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: God, I don’t believe this. She could be giving birth in the cab.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Ross, relax. It’s probably like two dollars for the first contraction, and then fifty cents for each additional contraction.
(Everyone looks at Rachel as though she made a tasteless comment.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What, it’s ok when Chandler does it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You have to pick your moments.
(Phoebe arrives, guitar in hand.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Did I miss it, did I miss it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: She’s not even here yet.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s with the guitar?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just thought we might be here for awhile. You know, things might get musical.
(Carol and Susan arrive.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Where the hell have you been?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: We stopped at the gift shop.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: I was looking at stuffed animals, and Susan wanted a Chunky .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Susan wanted a Chunky . We’re having a baby, ok, a baby, you don’t stop for Chunky s.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I used to have that bumper sticker.
(Everyone is amused by Chandler’s comment.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You see what I mean.

content.description: Carol’s Hospital Room, Carol is on the bed, Ross and Susan are at her side.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Stopped for a Chunky .

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Let it go, Ross.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: I got an extra one. You want this? (holds the candy in front of Ross’ face)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.
(Carol’s doctor, Dr. Franzblau arrives.)

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: Hey, how’s my favorite parenting team doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Dr. Franzblau, hi.

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: So, I understand you’re thinking of having a baby? Well, I see you’re nine months pregnant. That’s a good start. How you doing with your contractions?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh, I love them. Each one’s like a little party in my uterus.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: They’re every four minutes and last 55 seconds.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 59 seconds. (holds up his watch) Quartz, ha.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Swiss quartz, ha, ha.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Am I allowed to drink anything?

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: Ice chips, just ice chips. They’re at the nurses’ station.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’ll get it.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: No, I’m getting it. I’ll be right back.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I got it—I’m getting it!
(They both leave just as Rachel enters the room, holding a cup.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi, I thought you might like some ice chips.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And if you need anything else, I—(notices the handsome Dr. Franzblau)—do not believe we’ve met. Hi. I’m, uh, Rachel Green. I’m Carol’s… ex-husband’s… sister’s roommate.

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: It is nice to meet you. I’m Dr. Franzblau. I’m your roommate’s… brother’s… ex-wife’s obstetrician.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, that’s funny!

content.description: The Waiting Room, Chandler is falling asleep on Monica’s shoulder.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I want a baby.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mmmm. Not tonight, honey. I got an early day tomorrow.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Get up. Come on. Let’s get some coffee.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, ok, ’cause we never do that.
(Chandler and Monica leave. Cut to Joey, watching the Knicks/Celtics game on television.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Shoot! Shoot! Shoot! Shoot, or just fall down. That’s good too.
(A young pregnant woman enters.)

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Knick fan?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Oh, boy, do they suck.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, listen, lady…(sees that she’s pregnant)…whoa.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Look, look at your man, Ewing. Nice shot. You know what, he couldn’t hit water if he was standing on a boat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah? And who do you like?

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: The Celtics.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The Celtics? Ha. They couldn’t hit a boat if…wait. They suck, alright?

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Oh, shut up. You know, it’s a rebuilding year. You… waah!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wha? Wha..aa? Let me get the father. Hey, we need a father over here! We need a father!

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: There is no father.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, oh, oh, sorry.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Ok, that’s ok. I’m fine. I’m… oh!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, uh, ok. Right this way. All the other pregnant women seem to be goin’ in here.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Ok.
(Joey accompanies Lydia to a hospital room.)

content.description: The Waiting Room, Phoebe is playing a song. Chandler, Monica, and Ross are there as well.

content.text: (Ross gives Phoebe a dollar.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks, Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. I’m paying you to stop.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok.
(A woman passes by, carrying newborn twins.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, look, twins. Hi, guys. Oh, cute, cute.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No fair. I don’t even have one. How come they get two?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’ll get one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah? When?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right. I’ll tell you what. When we’re 40, if neither one of us are married, what do you say you and I get together and have one?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why won’t I be married when I’m 40?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, no, no. I just meant hypothetically.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, hypothetically, why won’t I be married when I’m 40?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, no.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is it? Is there something fundamentally unmarriable about me?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh, uh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Dear God! This parachute is a knapsack! (throws himself over the back of the chair he was sitting in)
(Rachel enters, in a formal dress.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey. Ooh, look at you, dressy-dress.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you go home and change?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well, it’s an important day. I wanna look nice. Um, has uh Dr. Franzblau been by?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I haven’t seen him.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, where is he? He is supposed to be here. (Pause) What if the baby needs him?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Rachel, what is the deal with you and doctors, anyway? Was, like, your father a doctor?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No reason. (turns around, makes an ‘Oh my God’ gesture with his eyes)

content.description: Joey and Lydia in the hospital room. Lydia is on the phone with her mother.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Mom, we’ve been through this. No, I’m not calling him. I don’t care if it is his kid, the guy’s a jerk. No, I’m not alone. Joey’s here. (pause) What do you mean, Joey who? (covers the phone, to Joey) Joey who?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Tribbiani.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Joey Tribbiani. Yes, ok. Hold on. (to Joey) She wants to talk to you. Take the phone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi, yeah, it’s me. (Listens) Oh, no no no, we’re just friends. (Listens) Yeah, I’m single. (Listens) 25. (Listens) An actor. (Listens) Hello?

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: She’s not much of a phone person.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, so, uh, so, uh, what’s the deal with this father guy, I mean, if someone was havin’ my baby somewhere, I’d wanna know about it, you know?

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Hey, Knick fan, am I interested in your views on fatherhood? Uh, no.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ok, look, maybe I should just go.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Maybe you should.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good luck, and uh, take care, huh?
(He leaves, but then returns a moment later.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know what the Celtics problem is? They let the players run the team.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Oh, that is so not true.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it is.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: It isn’t.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It is.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Isn’t!

content.description: Carol’s Hospital Room, Ross and Susan are coaching Carol.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Breathe.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Breathe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Breathe.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Breathe.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Breathe.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Breathe.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: You’re gonna kill me!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: 15 more seconds, 14, 13, 12…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Count faster.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: It’s gonna be ok, just remember, we’re doing this for Jordie. Just keep focusing on Jordie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who the hell is Jordie?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Your son.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no-no. I don’t have a son named Jordie. We all agreed, my son’s name is Jamie.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Well, Jamie was the name of Susan’s first girlfriend, so we went back to Jordie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? Whoa, whoa whoa whoa, what do you mean, back to Jordie? We never landed on Jordie. We just passed by it during the whole Jessy, Cody, Dylan fiasco.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ow, ow, ow, ow, leg cramp, leg cramp, leg cramp.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I got it.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: I got it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I got it! Hey, you get to sleep with her, I get the cramps.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: No, you don’t.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: All right, that’s it. I want both of you out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: He started it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, you started it.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: You did!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: I don’t care. I am trying to get a person out of my body here, and you’re not making it any easier.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: But…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Now go!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks a lot.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: See what you did.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, listen…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Out !
(Ross and Susan both angrily leave the hopsital room.)

content.description: Lydia’s Hospital Room, Joey is helping Lydia go through labor, a nurse is now present in her room as well.

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Breathe, breathe, breathe…

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Oh, no.
(Joey looks down at Lydia.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ew! What is that? Something exploded!

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: It’s just her water breaking. Calm down, will you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Water breaking, what do you mean? What’s that, water breaking?

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Breathe, breathe, breathe.

content.description: The Hall, Ross and Susan are arguing.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Please. This is so your fault.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: How, how is this my fault?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, Carol never threw me out of a room before you came along.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Yeah? Well, there’s a lot of things Carol never did before I came along.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You tryin’ to be clever? A funny lady?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: You know what your problem is? You’re threatened by me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I’m threatened by you?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Yes.
(Phoebe has heard them arguing and comes down the hall, taking them into a broom closet.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, hey, ok, all right, that’s it! Get in here. Come on. My god, you guys, I don’t believe you. There are children coming into the world in this very building and your negative fighting noises are not the first thing they should be hearing. So just stop all the yelling, just stop it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, Susan.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Don’t make me do this again, I don’t like my voice like this.
(Phoebe goes to leave the room, but the door is locked.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, who wants to hear something ironic?

content.description: The Broom Closet, Ross and Susan are trying to get out.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Help!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m having a baby in here! Ok, everyone stand back. (Walks backwards as if he is going to break down the door, but steps in a bucket and falls) Ow.

content.description: Carol’s room, Rachel and Dr. Franzblau are there with her.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Are they here yet?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, honey, they’re not, but don’t worry, because we are going to find them, and until we do, we are all here for you, ok?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, so anyway, you were telling me about Paris, it sounds fascinating.

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: It really was. There was this great little pastry shop right by my hotel. (Carol sits up in pain, Rachel and Dr. Franzblau casually lay her back down) There you go, dear.

content.description: Lydia’s Room, Joey is helping her deliver.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on, Lydia, you can do it. Push! Push ’em out, push ’em out, harder, harder. Push ’em out, push ’em out, way out! Let’s get that ball and really move, hey, hey, ho, ho. Let’s— (notices the nurse looking at him strangely) I was just—yeah, right. Push! Push!

content.description: The Broom Closet, Ross has picked up a vacuum and is holding it at the door.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: What’re you gonna do, suck the door open?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Help! Help!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: They found their bodies the very next day, they found their bodies the very next…(sees Ross and Susan staring at her) la la la la la la.

content.speaker: Susan and Ross
content.text: Help!

content.description: The Waiting Room, Monica is on the phone with her mother, Chandler is standing behind her.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now, Mom, everything’s going fine, really. (Listens) Yeah, Ross is great. He’s uh, he’s in a whole other place. (Listens) No, he’s gone. (Listens) No no, you don’t have to fly back, really. (Listens) What do you mean this might be your only chance? (Listens) Would you stop? I’m only 26, I’m not even thinking about babies yet.
(Monica sees a woman pass by with a baby, puts the phone to her chest, and starts to cry. Chandler takes the phone, makes a noise in it resembling static, and hangs up. Joey enters.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where have you been?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, just had a baby.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mazel tov!

content.description: The Waiting Room, Rachel and Dr. Franzblau have gone to get coffee.

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: I don’t know, could be an hour, could be three, but relax, she’s doing great. So, uh, tell me, are you currently involved with anyone?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, not at the moment, no, I’m not. Are you?

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: No, it’s hard enough to get women to go out with me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Right, yeah, I’ve heard that about cute doctors.

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: No, no, really. I suppose it’s because I spend so much time, you know, where I do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: I try not to let my work affect my personal life, but it’s hard, when you… do what I do. It’s like uh…Well, for instance, what do you do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m a waitress.

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: Ok, all right, well aren’t there times when you come home at the end of the day, and you’re just like, ‘if I see one more cup of coffee’…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Gotcha.

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: I’m gonna go check up on your friend.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok. That’s fine. (takes her earrings out)

content.description: The Hall Outside Lydia’s Room, Joey is walking up to Lydia’s room with balloons, but before he enters he sees that the baby’s father has arrived. He listens at the door.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: So how did you know I was even here?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Your mom called me. So is this her?

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: No, this is a loaner.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: I’m sorry you had to do this by yourself.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: I wasn’t by myself. I had a doctor, a nurse, and a helper guy. (Joey smiles) So, did you see who won the game?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Yeah, the Knicks by 10. They suck.

content.speaker: Lydia
content.text: Yeah, they’re not so bad.
(Joey closes the door and ties the balloons to the knob. Then he walks away, holding the hand of an inflated balloon animal he had brought.)

content.description: The Broom Closet, Ross is trying to open the door with a credit card, with no success.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, come on. Damnit, damnit, damnit, damnit. (to Susan) This is all your fault. This is supposed to be, like, the greatest day of my life, y’know? My son is being born, and I should be in there, you know, instead of stuck in a closet with you.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: The woman I love is having a baby today. I’ve been waiting for this just as much as you have.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No no no, believe me. No one has been waiting for this as much as I have, ok? And you know what the funny thing is? When this day is over, you get to go home with the baby, ok? Where does that leave me?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: You get to be the baby’s father. Everyone knows who you are. Who am I? There’s Mother’s Day, there’s Father’s Day, there’s no… Lesbian Lover Day.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Every day is Lesbian Lover Day.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is so great.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You wanna explain that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I mean, well, ’cause when I was growing up, you know my dad left, and my mother died, and my stepfather went to jail, so I barely had enough pieces of parents to make one whole one. And here’s this little baby who has like three whole parents who care about it so much that they’re fighting over who gets to love it the most. And it’s not even born yet. It’s just, it’s just the luckiest baby in the whole world. (pause) I’m sorry, you were fighting.

content.description: Carol’s Room, she is ready to give birth. Everyone is there except for Phoebe, Ross, and Susan, who are in the broom closet.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Where are they?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sure they’ll be here soon.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, honey, they wouldn’t miss this.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Relax. You’re only at nine centimeters. And the baby’s at zero station.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You are really frightening me.
(Carol suddenly screams in pain and grabs Chandler by the shirt.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Somebody wanna help me, tryin’ to rip out my heart. (they pull her hand off of him) Uh, that’s great. (looking around) Anybody seen a nipple?

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: All right, ten centimeters, here we go.

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: All right, honey, time to start pushing.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: But they’re not here yet!

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: I’m sorry, I can’t tell the baby to wait for them.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh, god.

content.description: The Broom Closet, Ross has used a broom to open the air vent in the ceiling. Phoebe is wearing a janitor’s uniform, ready to go up in the vent.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, got the vent open.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi, I’m Ben. I’m hospital worker Ben. It’s Ben… to the rescue!
content.parenthetical: reading the nametag on the uniform

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ben, you ready? All right, gimme your foot. Ok, on three, Ben. One, two, three. Ok, That’s it, Ben.
(Ross and Susan lift Phoebe up into the vent.)

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: What do you see?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, Susan, I see what appears to be a dark vent. Wait. Yes, it is in fact a dark vent.
(A janitor opens the closet door from the outside.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Phoebs, It’s open! It’s open!
(Ross and Susan run to the delivery room, leaving Phoebe dangling from the vent.)

content.speaker: Janitor
content.text: Wait! You forgot your legs!

content.description: Carol’s Room, Ross and Susan rush in.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Push, push!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re here!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Where have you been?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Long story, honey.

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: All right, Carol, I need you to keep pushing. I need—(reaches for an instrument, Rachel’s hand is on it) Excuse me, could I have this?

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: All right, all right, there’s a few too many people in this room, and there’s about to be one more, so anybody who’s not an ex-husband or a lesbian life partner, out you go!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Good luck!
(Everyone heads for the door.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let me ask you, do you have to be Carol’s lesbian life partner?

content.speaker: Nurse
content.text: Out!

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: All right, he’s crowning. Here he comes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let me see, I gotta see, I gotta see. Oh, a head. Oh, it’s, it’s huge. Carol, how are you doing this?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Not… helping!

content.speaker: Dr. Franzblau
content.text: You’re doing great, you’re doing fine.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello! (to Dr. Franzblau) Oh, sorry.
content.parenthetical: puts his head near the baby

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: What do you see? What do you see?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We got a head, we got shoulders, we got arms, we got, oh, look at the little fingers, oh, and a chest, and a stomach. It’s a boy, definitely a boy! All right! Ok, legs, knees, and feet. Oh, oh. He’s here. He’s a person.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Oh, look at that.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: What does he look like?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Kinda like my uncle Ed, covered in Jell-o .

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys, he’s beautiful!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thanks, Pheebs!
(They look up towards the vent and wave at Phoebe.)

content.description: The Delivery Room, Carol is holding the infant.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: No shouting, but we still need a name for this little guy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How ‘bout Ben?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: I like Ben.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ben. Ben. Ben’s good. How come you never mentioned Ben before?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We uh, we just cooked it up.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: That’s what we were off doing.
(Monica opens the door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can we come in?
(The whole gang enters.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know, I know. Everybody, there’s someone I’d like you to meet. Yeah. This is Ben. Ben, this is everybody.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Susan, he looks just like you.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, god, I can’t believe one of us actually has one of these.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I know, I still am one of these.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, can I?
(Monica holds Ben.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The head, the head. You gotta…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi, Ben. Hi. I’m your Aunt Monica. Yes I am. I’m your Aunt Monica. I…I will always have gum.

content.description: The Hospital, the camera is placed as though it were Ben’s eyes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ben, I want you to know that there may be some times when I may not be around, like this. (walks out of the picture) But I’ll still always come back, like this. (returns) And sometimes I may be away longer, like this. (walks away) But I’ll still always come back, like this. (returns)
(Chandler comes into the picture.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And sometimes, I’ll want you to steal third, and I’ll go like this. (Does a baseball sign.)
(The rest of the group come into the picture.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He is so amazing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I know. Look at him.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ben, Ben, hey Ben. Nothing. I don’t think that’s his name.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, look, look, he’s closing his eyes. (screen goes blank) Look, he’s opening his eyes. (picture comes back)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: He doesn’t do much, does he?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, this is pretty much it.
(long moment of silence)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys wanna get some coffee?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, I’ll see you guys later.
(They all leave but Ross, but they all come back a few seconds later. They make faces at the baby.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, look, he’s closing his eyes again.
(The screen fades to black.)
